intro: Lacostea tuerckheimii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a compact rosette structure. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and red, making it a popular ornamental plant. Lacostea tuerckheimii prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
